jibe.sdk.client.authentication
Class AuthenticationEvent

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.events.JibeEvent
      jibe.sdk.client.authentication.AuthenticationEvent

public class AuthenticationEvent
extends JibeEvent

A JibeEvent class, used to keep the user informed of changes of authentication status.

Field Detail

LOGIN_SUCCESSFUL

public static final int LOGIN_SUCCESSFUL
Event code.

The login to the Jibe account has been successfully completed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOGIN_FAILED

public static final int LOGIN_FAILED
Event code.

The login to the Jibe account has failed. The event's info contains further information about the cause of the failure.

public static final int FAIL_INVALID_CREDENTIALS
Information value.

FAIL_DUPLICATE_ACCOUNT

public static final int FAIL_DUPLICATE_ACCOUNT
Information value.

The registration a new Jibe account has failed, because an account with the given credentials already exists.

Constant Field Values

FAIL_NICKNAME_NOT_ALPHANUMERIC

public static final int FAIL_NICKNAME_NOT_ALPHANUMERIC
Information value.

The registration a new Jibe account has failed, because the nickname is not in the specified format. (alphanumeric, no special characters, no blank space)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FAIL_NICKNAME_TOO_LONG

public static final int FAIL_NICKNAME_TOO_LONG
Information value.

The registration a new Jibe account has failed, because the nickname more than 30 characters long

Information value.

Constant Field Values

FAIL_NO_CREDENTIALS

public static final int FAIL_NO_CREDENTIALS
Information value.

Jibe account login has failed, because credentials are not available This indicates that Jibe account registration is required before login can be executed

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FAIL_NO_SIM

public static final int FAIL_NO_SIM
Information value.

Jibe account login has failed, because a SIM is not available

Constructor Detail

AuthenticationEvent

public AuthenticationEvent(int eventCode,
                           long source,
                           long info)
Standard constructor.

Parameters:
eventCode - Event code, as defined above.
source - ID of the community that is the source of this event.
info - Additional info, as defined above (for example, PASSWORD_RESET_SUCCESSFUL).
